title: PSA: Do NOT buy lootboxes with RP
body:
It is not even close to worth buying lootboxes with RP at this point. The amount of Orange and Blue Essence you get out of them has gone down ***drastically.*** The amount of Orange Essence you get for disenchanting is now half. Blue Essence from disenchanting is obviously down as well. This is a warning to just buy the skin you want instead of opting for lootboxes.

This is not thread debating "Yeah, but we get more shards from leveling!". Whether we do or do not, this isnt a thread discussing that. This is specifically for lootboxes purchased with RP. The message of this thread is simple:

***Although the RP price of lootboxes has remained the same,*** the value of the content in those boxes has dropped by ***half*** compared to a box you bought a week ago. Until there is some form of compensation for purchasing them with RP, do not buy any.

replies.body: Riot probably should take a look at the box prices. As you said, it doesn't give as much anymore, so they should go down in cost.

They likely won't. Their worth might not have changed based on their perception. Lootboxes can now drop chest + key, additionally there is bad luck protection. Yeah it's not much from my point of view either, but they literally drastically nerfed OE from disenchanting because you get extra box every blue moon at milestones that may not even drop OE based content.

So If they actually thought the boxes from leveling are good enough reason to drop the worth of shards, they will certainly defend themself that these minor changes to lootboxes maintain their prize.

Also lootboxes were never really worth buying with RP even before. Maybe in very special cases when you lacked minor amount of OE to redeem content you got from free chests, but other than that it's overpriced since you don't instantly get the content inside but need several chests to grind OE AND you can end up getting content you could've grinded for free.

Riot's purchasable lootboxes were always scam. It's just that some people probably really love this company when they go crazy and scream "hazard" with every other company applying unfair lootboxes, but they don't mind the fact they can actually get content worth less than what they paid If it comes from someone they like.

It's been whale-bait up to this point so why should they now change it? People will still buy it, just like people pay for the over-glorified Chromas or the pathetic Emotes.
But isn't bad luck protection only for Level Up boxes? They're not the same as Hextech Chests y'know?

Also, you only get (at best) 2 things from a crate. 

Maybe if your crate opened and got something like 2-3 items (with one being a guaranteed shard) it could be justified but right now you're paying 0.99 cents or so for what is basically a champion shard with an incredibly slim chance at a gemstone.

We're talking about a company charging huge amounts of $ for minimal gain, look at so much as a tiny example of chromas where people on the boards were making better quality ones in Photoshop and 3D programs in under an hour.

As somebody who was dumb enough to buy the 10-pack Legacy Orb which is now worth so little I can get like 2 skins out of it... FUCK YOU RIOT. And I wish I had known the orange essence value was also going down and not just BE.
Not only this, but now there's less likely for skins to drop because they now share a drop chance with emotes.

Officially the orange essence for disenchanting changed from 33% to 20%, so if it's actually half its more likely a bug. Suspect it's not literally half though and saying whatever that actual ratio is is a pain.

Also worth noting theres bad luck protection of hextech crates now, so you're assured a skin shard/gemstone within X crates (don't remember the number off the top of my head).

Neither of those things should be taken as disagreeing that the value of hextech crates has gone down, but those are both things to at least be aware of if we're talking about crate value.

Why should I pay to get 195 essence from a 975RP skin shard? 

The bad luck protection argument makes no sense imo. That stuff is REQUIRED in the current system since you need like 6 shards to unlock a 975RP skin now, whereas before you needed half that amount.

Lootboxes are horrible in the first place.  This is online gambling people and the odds are MASSIVELY in the houses favor.  

Why do you think that every game company out there is going for this lootbox/lootcrate method?  Because they are BANKING off of it.  They are taking advantage of people's addictions and lack of finances.  Someone doesn't have the cash to purchase expensive skins?  Try your luck at a lootbox/lootcrate.  

I'm sorry but in my opinion, companies should AT LEAST provide the ratios that they have given their gambling boxes for the products that pop out.  You know that basic shit tier stuff has a 95% chance of coming out of those things and the valuable stuff has an extremely low chance of coming out.  Hell, who knows if something was excluded from it entirely.  They don't have to tell you shit.

Honestly, I have always appreciated Riot's business strategies when it came to people using real money and there is a reason why it works so well for them but I will NEVER support this rng online gambling lootbox bullshit ESPECIALLY to minors (except it's jumping through legal loopholes since lootboxes aren't classified as online gambling as far as I know).  

I'm sorry but video games are going down the wrong road and getting way too greedy.  Micro-transactions and DLC's are spiraling out of control and I understand that LoL is entirely based on a micro-transaction model and that's completely fine (as long as that model is fair and LoL's model has been a great standard in the past) but there is a line that you shouldn't cross and RNG lootboxes is across that line for me.  Gamers need to stand up and speak out together to try and slow down this greedy bullshit and hopefully stop it down the road.  If not, the game industry is going to spiral out of control and you're going to have to end up paying to reload your gun on CoD or revive yourself in LoL.

As much as people so often bash on China for everything, at least they have it that game companies (or at least their branch in China) are legally required to show the odds of lootboxes. And we could use that too.

What difference would it make if you knew your chances or not?
Are people still deluding themselves into thinking they have good chances, even after having a gut feeling they don't? Or they need that in official writing so that they know for sure the chances are not in their favor?

Some people are lucky and can open a box with the most expensive skin in their first go (my friend got Elementalist Lux) while i opened 40 or so boxes (just from S ranks) and have gotten only (from what i recall) Program Lissandra i actually wanted to own (i have a few more skins for her i want but i don't play her regularly). What people want depends on what's their prefered champion pool and what skins they actually want out of them.

If they have many skins, loot boxes sound like a perfect idea. Whatever they get sounds like a perfect plan to stock up on any skin cheaper than what you can buy in the store. But even Riot has said that if you want something specific, the cheapest option is to buy it directly, not from loot boxes.
---
When you have a mini-game of chance in any game, always assume you're getting the short end of the stick. You can get incredibly lucky and get that rare perfect thing it's advertised or you can get nothing, most of the time. So if you ever intend to buy loot boxes, buy them responsibly and in smaller quantities to make sure the money you spend on them satisfies your curiosity but doesn't end in regret from overspending.

Preach it, my intellectual brother!

There is nothing wrong with trading money for a product that you know you are receiving. It's called commerce. There is also nothing wrong with betting real money on an unforeseeable event, it's called gambling. 

However, in most places you need to be an adult (in the US the age is 18) in order to be able to make the decision to gamble. You need to be old enough to understand that what you are receiving is likely not worth the amount of REAL MONEY that you are putting in. 

I'll forego all of the grandstanding I want to do and just urge players not to get suckered. The only way any of this will change (undoubtedly in the favor of players) is if enough people stop falling for it and these companies stop making all of the money in the goddamn world.

Sadly for every one player who sees through this scam, thousands will still buy boxes. And since wallets speak louder than words, Riot will keep on with this atrocity.

"But it's OK because you get more sources of orange essence"
My ass you do. What, one extra shard every milestone level? Boxes giving less champion shards but getting saturated with useless emotes instead? Riot straight out lied on this one.
the thing is you dont get skin shards from lvl up. soo i didnt see why they lowerd OE

Exactly. Supposed extra sources of orange essence are far too scarce to compensate for massive loss in shard disenchanting. Anyone who can do basic math can see that buying chests is simply not worth it anymore; if you want to spend some RP you get better value of your money when buying specific items rather than gambling. And higher effective value in exchange for randomness is what makes this kind of gambling enticing; take the extra value away and there is no point in it.

Now let's just hope that people who can do basic math outnumber people with severe gambling addiction here, or we are all boned. Tho I'm really skeptical about that, as evidenced in my first post.
No to mention you can now get emotes from those things. By far the most useless addition to the game.
